title: What kind of services can the butler that is included in my suite provide? - Quora

response.answer_text: A hotel butler takes the idea of personalized service to a whole new level. A hotel butler will act as the single point of contact to access all hotel services and assist with a wide range of personal services, such as: Unpacking your clothes into the wardrobes/tall boys in your bedroom at the start of your stay and repacking before your departureArranging any laundry or dry cleaning requiredShoe shining, pressing suits, ironing shirts etcProviding information and expert advice on local sights and attractionsTaking care of any tour bookings, arranging tickets for shows you want to see, restaurant reservations, ordering taxis etcSetting the dining table and serving food, including breakfast in bedServing drinks, including your favorite cocktails or other drinks you preferRunning a bath and adding personal touches, like rose petals and candles for a romantic soak with your partnerBed turndown service (if not performed by housekeeping)Providing some services of a business personal assistant, such as updating your diary, arranging business meetings, typing letters, printing, arranging postage etcPlanning and assisting with any entertaining/parties you would like to hold in your suiteTaking care of any ad-hoc requests, like ordering a masseuse, buying something specific from a specific store etcIf you are not sure exactly what services your hotel butler will provide - just ask. A hotel butler is there to provide you with information and to put your mind as ease.

As a Butler myself, I feel that there are a large array of services a butler provides - Anything from serving the welcome beverage, unpacking cases, shoeshine, arranging for housekeeping staff to tend to guest rooms at preferred times, arranging sightseeing, serving food and beverages, collect and return laundry, arrange airport transfers, tickets for a movie/concert, or any specific guest needs. Butlers are trained to satisfy guest requests and do all that i possible in their limits, at times, gaining approvals from the managers for certain special requests. In most hotels, a Butler is a blend of a couple of roles as the floors that provide butler service, have only 1 or 2 specific butlers attend to a particular guest, so that there is familiarity and guest needs are taken care of to the entirety. Ideally you can call a butler a blend of a personal assistant, waiter, concierge, at times manservant or housekeeping man, secretary, valet etc.
